review: I have been taking Simvastatin for ten years. When I first started taking them I  had quite a lot of muscle pain but the pain eventually went away after a year or so.  A month ago my doctor changed me to Atorvastatin (Why, I don't know ), within a month I have muscle pain returned, weak legs, plus I seem to get irritable easily.Worried !

The only atorvastatin I am able to take is made by the "Lupin" manufacturer. All others have given me horrific Charlie horses in both my legs & feet. So far I have found that Walgreens carries this manufacturer. It works pretty well on my blood work too.

Lipitor (atorvastatin):I began taking atorvastatin after cardiac bypass surgery. 4 arteries 75%+ blocked. Starting at 40mg my LDL cholesterol level dropped dramatically, and my HDL climbed slightly. Had some issues with muscle cramping especially in legs, so Dr. cut dosage to 20 mg. after 6 months on lower dosage my HDL is 58,  LDL is 42, triglyceride is 56, total cholesterol 106. Cardiac doc says these are great #s, and muscle problems are minimal, with no other side effects. Heart surgery is no fun at all, do what you can to avoid it.

I have been on this pill for 2 months now. Experiencing  the same side effects muscles  aches, cramps, headache, nausea  and stomach problems. By reading what others says about this drug helped me to understand why I'm  having all these pains without realizing  that it's due to this drug. Got to see my Doctor .

Then what , if they are. Does this muscle inflammation stop or will I become a cripple? I am very fearful and waiting for results.

I've been involved with physical sports over many years and received a few bangs to different parts of my body, the finger was one I think.Next thing I had terrible pain in my right hip buttock area, I believe I had a crash while skiing many years ago but never been problematic.Next thing my shoulder, rotator area starts giving me terrible pain. The hip pain has spread to the back of my right leg and now my left leg.I can't do my shoes up, pick anything off the floor and have a lot of trouble getting in my car.When I first got the hip pain I waited for four weeks, hoping it would go away because I'm normally a fast healer, it didn't go away so I saw the doctor. I've had an X-ray that showed nothing wrong. Do you think this is statin related?

Horrible medication.After just a week on a low dose I started to feel exhausted, no energy, low mood, sleep disturbance, waking up in the middle of the night.  Confusion, lack of concentration, dizziness, reduced appetite, depression.There must be something better than these awful drugs.

Lipitor (atorvastatin):Doctor put me on Lipitor after my heart attack.   It destroyed my memory over 6 months.  Short term memory almost non-existent; large gaps in long term memory.  I’d meet someone on the street whom I’d worked with for 20 years and could not remember their name.It also made me a very nasty, rude, insulting person.  I lost several good friends because of nasty things I said, and destroyed a 20 year relationship.  My wife threatened to leave me if I didn’t stop taking it.  I stopped, my cholesterol went high again, and I don’t care.  That was ten years ago, and my short term memory has pretty much returned, but there are still large gaps in long term memory.   I don’t care how high my cholesterol goes; I will never take another statin.

Decided to stop sugar and lose weight instead of taking cholesterol meds. Also, requested from library: Pure, White and Deadly.

I avoid eating meat now, and exercise most days of the week.  My LDL declined to 67.I have not felt any side effects, so this medication works great for me.

This drug has really had a negative impact on my life.Unfortunately, I took atorvastatin for about 18 months before I finally pinpointed that it was definitely the cause of my problems.Aching joints, muscle spasms, digestive discomfort, nausea, indigestion and fatigue.After one of my friends told me that he had numerous side effects from the same medication, I stopped taking it.Within 2-3 days I was feeling 100% better.One of my doctors told me that she did not think that the medication was the root of my problems but to be sure, start back taking it and see if the symptoms returns.Within 1 full day of taking a morning dose, all of the horrible side effects returned with the same severity.That's it ....I stopped taking it again and within a couple of days all of the side effects let again.Maybe some people are affected differently but for some, this medication doesn't suit me at all

I also felt very light headed and nauseous. I ended up having to take diazepam, 8 paracetamol a day and lactulose 3 times a day. I told my doctor and he advised me to stop taking them straight away. I am hoping I will soon be back to normal and able to continue walking my 5 to 8 miles a day even at 70 years of age. Never again will I take a statin.

During the 6 months, I worked hard to lose 30 pounds eating clean, also eliminating dairy and gluten, and develop an exercise regimen to include cardio and resistance training. I added CoQ10 and magnesium supplements but didn’t see any relief from the symptoms. At the 6 month follow up, all my numbers looked good accept my A1c which now categorized me as prediabetic, despite low fasting glucose. I told the HCP, no more, I was done with it. My biggest regret is not going in before the 6 month recheck.

I took atorvastatin 20mg & I experienced the worst symptoms ever! I took the medicine for 2 1/2 months. My doctor checked my blood work again 4/21 & it went down! And now 8 months later & I still have symptoms!

review: After twelve years of my Doctor insisting that I take something for my high cholesterol, I finally agreed to take Atorvastatin. I took it for a month and a half, but started getting red blotches on my skin.  These hives appeared everywhere on my body. The itch was horrendous.  I didn't see the correlation between the drug and the blotches until my wife googled my condition.  I was having an allergic reaction to the Atorvastatin. It was  CIU (Chronic Idiopathic Urticaria). A "living nightmare" I was experiencing! My wife advised me to get off of it and for one week, no problems. But my Doctor advised against it. Got back on it and the hives came back with a vengeance. Hopefully, this drug will soon be exorcised from my body (metaphorically speaking of course), and I will be able to get back to some sort of normalcy? People, be careful if you take this drug! It effects different people in different ways. You might roll the dice and get a seven, or conversely, roll and get snake eyes!
Weight gain!
